Governmental organizations and regulatory bodies can play a significant role in influencing Embraer's R&D efforts in several ways:

1. Funding: Governmental organizations may provide funding for Embraer's R&D projects, especially if they align with national priorities such as defense or sustainable aviation. For example, Brazil's National Bank for Economic and Social Development has provided loans to Embraer for R&D and innovation projects.

2. Regulations: Regulatory bodies such as the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and the European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) set safety and environmental standards that Embraer must meet in order to obtain certification for its products. Embraer must therefore invest in R&D to ensure compliance with these regulations.

3. Standards: Governments and regulatory bodies may set standards for technology and innovation that can inform Embraer's R&D efforts. For example, the European Union's Clean Sky program aims to develop environmentally-friendly aviation technologies, and Embraer has participated in this program to develop more efficient and sustainable aircraft.

4. Collaboration: Governmental organizations and regulatory bodies can facilitate collaboration between Embraer and other companies, universities, and research institutions. For example, Embraer has partnered with Brazil's Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation, and the National Institute of Space Research to develop technology for remote sensing and earth observation.

Overall, governmental organizations and regulatory bodies can provide financial support, set standards and regulations, and facilitate collaboration, all of which can influence Embraer's R&D efforts.
